title.rendered: Minecraft: Shop Minecraft for 4,294,967,295 Microsoft Points

content.rendered:
10.05.2012 at 14:46 by Susanne Braun – Youtube user Ulkreghz recorded a curiosity on Xbox Live. When he went to buy Minecraft for the Xbox, he was shown a price for the game that would have thrown anyone backwards. Because instead of the usual 1,600 Microsoft points, Ulkreghz should suddenly score 4,294,967,295 points.

It’s probably not every day that a version of Minecraft is so incredibly expensive that only well-heeled Minecraft fans can afford it. But that’s what happened to Youtube user Ulkreghz. Entitled “Silly, Mojang it really isn’t worth THAT much,” Ulkreghz uploaded a video of his recent Xbox Live Marketplace shopping spree. And that demonstrates a pretty outrageous display bug when buying Minecraft from Mojang.

Instead of the usual 1,600 Microsoft Points, Minecraft for the Xbox should suddenly cost 4,294,967,295 points – that corresponds to a price of more than 46 million euros. A little blocky sandbox game isn’t worth that much… by the way, Minecraft inventor Notch also tweeted Ulkreghz’s video, including some jokes about Bill Gates buying a version.
